title: Research & Teaching
text:
Currently, I am a master student of the Statistics Education program at the University of Minnesota, under the supervision of Dr.¬†Chelsey Legacy and Dr.¬†Andrew Zieffler. I am studying under a Fulbright scholarship.
For my master degree research, I am analyzing some of the psychometrics properties of the third version of the Statistics Teacher Inventory (STI), a survey designed to collect information on teaching practices of introductory statistics instructors in a variety of institutions and departments across the United States post-secondary education system, so we can 1) create a better understanding of the instrument itself, 2) improve the instrument for latter versions, and 3) analyze the relationship between the latent constructs measured by the STI and the Guidelines for Assessment and Instruction in Statistics Education (GAISE).
I am also doing research with some cool research groups. These are: Lab Advancing Statistics Education Research (LASER)1, Minnesota Youth Development Research Group (MyDrG), Development, Affective Neuroscience, Culture and Environment (DANCE)2.
Overall, I like to perform statistical analysis to answer questions that may have a positive impact educational settingsMy research interests can be summarize into:

title: Research & Teaching
text:
Teaching 
Most of my ‚Äúformal‚Äù teaching has happened at the Department of Statistics at the University of Costa Rica. There, I have taught and TAed a variety of courses ranging from basic stats to mathematical statistics. Some of them are:

XS-0215: Biostatistics
XS-1110: Introduction to Statistics I
XS-1130: Introduction to Statistics II
XS-2330: Continuous Probabilistic Models
XS-3150: Statistical Principles for the Design of Experiments I
XS-3170: Applied Statistics for Experimental Designs
XS-3310:

At the UofM

title: Pablo Vivas
text:
Hello..!!
I‚Äôm Pablo. I am an enthusiastic Statistics educator and StatEd researcher. I love anything related to teaching and learning statistics (or as people in the wild call it: data science). I truly enjoy discussing stats with people from other fields, especially medical-related  and cognitive-related  fields. I am also passionate about scientific divulgation and breaking down ‚Äúcomplicated processes‚Äù into simple pieces so anyone can digest them. Knowledge should be accessible to anyone. My attention span is limited, that is why I am involved in‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶Gosh, I forgot what I was going to say.
Anyway, I am working hard so I can foster good students, awesome researchers, and outstanding data-thinkers.
I am very lucky to be surrounded, at this stage in my life, with people who bear my not-at-all-brilliant questions and are willing to discuss, virtually anything. These awesome people are, mostly, in the Quantitative Methods in Education program and the Psychological foundations of education program.
Nose around my website to learn more‚Ä¶.You might find something interesting ü§î.
Last updated: 2023-10-13

title: Pablo Vivas
text: Hi there! I‚Äôm Sam (and my last name is pronounced ‚Äúchick‚Äù). Professionally, I love teaching data science skills, learning and implementing inclusive pedagogical approaches, and the communities that supports both of those things. Outside of work, I‚Äôm an avid hiker, novice (but passionate) meal-maker, and I really love the color green. Poke around my website to learn more!
